item.title: Giving QR codes superpowers
item.description: QR codes have replaced bar codes in many places because they can store a lot more information, but this advantage is limited by the fact that they can only store textual data and have no inherent structure. In this post, I’ll demonstrate how to overcome these limitations and give QR codes superpowers! QR Codes and Their Limitations QR codes were invented by the Japanese company Denso Wave in the mid-90s as a way to get higher information density into machine-readable optical labels.
